website_summaries.verdict: It offers a nice design and features users love. The downside is the questionable reliability of some functions.
pros: In addition to 8 outlets that include 2 ACs, it has 4 USB charging ports
Longer warranty (18 months) than some competitors
cons: USB ports have been known to malfunction

customer_reviews.title: Best bestek surge protector with USB ports
customer_reviews.text: The 8 outlet surge protector is amazing. It also has 2 USB charging ports which makes this surge protector the best option if you have multiple devices and products that need charging. The outlet plug is flat which means that it can be plugged in behind a dresser or cabinet and will sit just a few centimeters off the wall. The surge protector has handled multiple devices plus high voltage products all at the same time and has never tripped power. I am pleased with this bestek product and am a previous owner of two of their other surge protectors as well.
customer_reviews.author: PBANDJ

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This power strip works as advertised. The USB charging ports are convenient and the flat plug allows the thick power cable to lie flat against the wall instead of jutting out. Perhaps my only gripe is that socket spacing on the power strip could be wider, considering the form factor. But still spacing is wider than most I have tried and it seems possible to use all eight AC outlets if I needed to. We’ll see how this works out overtime, but after several weeks of use so far, I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Nat Price

customer_reviews.title: Designed with the Consumer in Mind
customer_reviews.text: I bought this power strip because our main first floor outlet which had become a revolving hub of USB chargers. I thought it might be nice to be able to charge more than two things at one time, especially since some of the chargers come with large irregularly shaped heads. This strip allows for all kinds of plugs, and it has changed our charging station into a very efficient "Grand Central Station" of power cords. The six foot cord length is nice but unnecessary for our situation. Comes with a velcro strip to bind the excess up, which is a nice added feature. A well-thought-out product. Very happy with this buy.
customer_reviews.author: DutchrubTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Good table top or bedside power strip
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised how flat this strip was. The built in USB ports make keeping your devices mobile easy. I do not travel with this strip but bought some 3 pack charging cables and I keep 2 plugged in to high speed ports for my iPad and Samsung S7 charging pad. Then extra ports for my older devices. When I hit the road, keeping additional cables and the device issued wall plugs in my back pack - I never forget to have what I need with me. It is wall mountable and when I get my captains bed build with a book shelf headboard, I'm going to mount this for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: MadMac

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my home office desk!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find it anywhere in the product description, but it IS labeled on the bottom as being UL listed. It is also ETL listed. This power strip is perfect for my desk! I can connect my laptop, Chromebook, two monitors, a sound amp, a light, and my USB devices to a single, switchable source. There is plenty of room for charging blocks and the Quick Charge 3.0 port works great with my wireless phone charger.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Space Saver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this power strip to help reduce the "cord spaghetti" around my tech hub, and it works perfectly! There are enough outlets, and the spacing of the furthest ones allows for larger plugs to share the space. I made sure to buy a surge protector as well, and so far this has protected my devices in a few surges. One of the less important, but still important, features was that this strip can be hung on a wall. To my surprise, the company thoughtfully enclosed a template for drilling holes into the wall! Totally unnecessary, but a really nice touch!
customer_reviews.author: Cat LadyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Updated-  great customer service  Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: The company has recently contacted me re my dissatisfaction with this product. The customer service has been great. I was offered a free replacement, which I didnt need. The I accepted a partial refund, which I appreciate. The vendor is very interested in customer satisfaction. I changed my review accordingly. This has been great - for almost a year. It started burning and sparking today. My husband is an electronic engineer and confirmed I wasn't crazy, smelling something that wasn't there. I love being able to plug my phone/tablet directly into the strip without an adapter. I can plug in various types of plugs without covering other plugs. But, the longevity sucks.
customer_reviews.author: cataficianado

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Failed After Onloy Six Months
customer_reviews.text: After only 6 months of use you can hear something shorting out on the inside of this surge protector. Funny a surge protector that fails after 6 months and becomes a hazard. Either poor quality materials used in manufacture or poor Quality Assurance at the factory. My advice if you bought one of these pay attention it may be shorting out on the inside and be dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: TopDog

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea but Horrible Buzzing Noise
customer_reviews.text: == Summary == The moment I plugged in this power strip, an annoying buzzing noise began to emit from the power strip. The buzzing noise became even louder after plugging in a USB cable (see my short video clips). I've NEVER owned any power strips that make such noises. Big fail. I'm highly disappointed that this product didn't work out for me. *Pros: -Great concept integrating USB charging ports into the surge-protected power strip. -Nice layout of ports. *Cons: -Extremely loud & annoying buzzing noise that only becomes louder after plugging in a USB cable. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: optimummind

customer_reviews.title: Fried My Phone!
customer_reviews.text: Had my phone plugged into a USB, and then my phone started smoking! I originally thought this was related to my phone, but then other items plugged in through the USB started smoking as well! Crazy! Could have started a fire and now I'm out a phone! It worked fine until this point, so I can understand the reviews, but look at some of the negatives. Some people directly point out that something about the wiring could lead to something like this. I don't think it's worth that chance.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Surge Protector power strip! Very satisfied. I keep this on the floor between bed and nightstand. My bed is also my primary chair/couch, so I use a lot of electrical and electronic devices from here and need both the usb and power plugins. Most strips have no or two usb ports, and this one has four, which is why I got it. Also, it has the flat style plug in for the wall, so it fits behind my bed well. I've been using it for a few months now, and am very pleased. I've never run out of plugins, which with others I have.
customer_reviews.author: Mr max

customer_reviews.title: No safety shutters / not tamper resistant
customer_reviews.text: Bestek used to make these power strips with safety shutters and the listing still states that they come with safety shutters. I ordered one of these in February 2019 and NO safety shutters. So, I returned. I've bought several Bestek power strips in the past and I was very satisfied--especially because they have the child-resistant safety shutters. I don't know why they are leaving the shutters out on this latest manufacturing batch but they should update their website listing to be accurate. It's a pain to buy it and then go through a return!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and useful
customer_reviews.text: Outlets are well-positioned and well-spaced to accommodate different types and sizes of plugs. The USB connectors deliver all the wattage/amperage advertised to charge any device, including high demand tablets. I carry a phone for work, my owner personal phone, and have an additional portable device that needs charging every day. Many of the devices can use the same cable, but one is unique. Combine that with the quantity of devices, and I end up typically needing three USB type cables plugged in. This strip allows for all of my devices to be plugged in to charge at the same time without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: ember1205

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully I do not come off sounding like the bought and paid for crowd
customer_reviews.text: I vowed to never buy another product on Amazon that had “bought and paid for reviews” through discounts and free products. Since this surge protector had everything I needed, USB ports, appropriately spaced outlets, and a flat plug for space saving, I had to make an exception. Boy was I pleasantly surprised! In addition to my wish list, the outlet holes have additional protection from something dropping in and it was packaged extremely well. Hopefully I do not come off sounding like the bought and paid for crowd, but I am very impressed with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Surprised

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about six weeks
customer_reviews.text: I mainly purchased this for the USB charging ports, secondarily for the outlets for our 3-season gazebo which in enclosed with heat and A/C for the summer. The gazebo is fed with a dedicated 20-amp circuit with GFCI. Several days ago the GFCI started tripping. When reset, it would trip again in maybe 10 seconds or so; sometimes less. Troubleshooting conclusively showed that the Bestek power strip was the culprit. I tried the power strip on another GFCI circuit with the same result. I have used other surge protector power strips in the gazebo for years without issue. I wanted the Bestek one for the USB ports to tidy up the separate USB chargers plugged into my original power strip.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H

customer_reviews.title: Did not last 8 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: This surge protector was not 8 weeks in operation in my home when a powerline blackout made it useless. I have at least 5 other older surge protectors installed in the same electrical circuit and none of them presented any flaws, neither the devices that were plugged in them (I must confess that also none of the devices plugged in this Bestek when the blackout occurred were also affected in any way). Although from an 'outside perspective' this surge protector looks nice and seems to be well engineered and constructed, I suggest everyone to stay far away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Simoni S.

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The actual outlet is fine but has 1 design flaw: The really fat plug faces DOWN so if you want to plug it to the "upper" outlet plug hole it will absolutely block the lower one..which is a problem since my place is wired where the bottom holes are wired to the on & off switch in the living room lamp....had to completely move my table and cables around just to make this thing work :(
customer_reviews.author: Yurika

customer_reviews.title: QC 3 did not work in both units I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 units. Quick charging did not work in both units I ordered. Tried testing with different QC enabled devices, different cables and 2 different USB meters. I tried using QC device on all ports, none of the ports were able to provide QC (not even the dedicated port for QC). So was disappointed. On the good side: Good chord length, unit gives high power/current output to iPad (5V, not QC) as measured by a reliable USB meter. Quality control should be more stringent. Returned one item only as I need a power strip very bad so ended up keeping one out of two. I would certainly be on lookout for another QC enabled power strip.
customer_reviews.author: Innovative Doc

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, Both failed. First one Shut my Phone off.
customer_reviews.text: Don't. Just leave this one. If you're enticed by this because of the quick charge 3 capabilities, don't. It's a constant battle to actually this thing to actually fast charger your phone and has LITERALLY caused my phone to shut off before frying the Quick charge unit. I gave it another try and got another repalcment thinking it was a fluke and the second unit has failed already. These are actually garbage. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Faisal Pk

customer_reviews.title: Overhyped in reviews! Not true USB quick charge!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to this surge protector because it was only the few that offered usb quick charge, however, I was really disappointed to find out after plugging in my phone that it's just a standard 2.4 amp port. And for a standard usb charging usb port, I can find better price surge protectors on Amazon. The strip itself also feels quite warm to the touch after a few days of use. Overall looks solid, but for a brand that's not very well known, it's totally over priced. I ended up ordering an APC Surge protector with usb instead.
customer_reviews.author: b.c.

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is A+
customer_reviews.text: Although initially I got the wrong length cord, this seller has excellent customer service and sent me an even longer cord than I had ordered because she wanted me to be completely happy. This seller is reliable and concerned that you get what you ordered and that you are completely satisfied. The cord is very good too!! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DeannaRuth

customer_reviews.title: Not UL certified
customer_reviews.text: Only found out after I purchased this surge protector that this is not UL certified. I didn't read the description carefully enough. I found this information to be helpful: Check for the UL seal, and make sure it's a "transient voltage surge suppressor." Making sure that the surge protector you're planning to buy is both certified by Underwriter's Laboratories, and at least meets their UL 1449 standards (required for the label "transient voltage surge suppressor,") will make sure the surge protector you take home will actually protect the equipment you plug into it.
customer_reviews.author: P. King

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted for my side of the bed. I have an I-Phone and a Kindle. Each take a different charging cord and the USB ports on this Surge Protector allows me to plug them both in without taking up an outlet spot. The extra outlets are great for plugging in my light and alarm clock. It came quickly as promised. I am very happy with my purchase and my husband wants one for his side of the bed too, so I'll be ordering another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a surge protector
customer_reviews.text: This item was advertised as a surge protector, but it is just a power strip. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right amount of inputs, but USB randomly shuts off
customer_reviews.text: USB ports randomly flicker and shut off. I have lights attached and I am concerned to leave them on when I'm away from home. Shortage are very risky, and can cause a fire. Disappointed because these lights need to remain on with no interruption, and we have an animal at home. A few months in, I'm a bit worried about the quality of the power strip. The amount of inputs is spot-on, though.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted - Updated 11/26/2019
customer_reviews.text: Overall the outlet is fine, not great, but fine. The plastic isn't the heavy-duty plastic you're used to from apc / etc, it feels cheaper and lighter. That said, it performed just fine... until today. I now have no power to the USB ports so this is worthless to me. I realized it wasn't a reputable brand but i expected it to last longer than 6 months... disappointing. 11/26/2019 -- vendor contacted me directly for a refund. changed my review from 2 stars to 4 for the effort / refund.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Owner of this strip and a lot of fried electronics
customer_reviews.text: Have had my entertainment system plugged into this unit since we bought it about 105 days ago. Went through a lightning storm an hour ago and I lost half off the electronics plugged into the strip - my directv dvr, my play station 4, and my att uverse router. I can’t find anything on how to contact customer service to submit a warranty claim. If you can afford to some of your electronics you want to plug into this thing than please make your purchase. If not, then look for a brand that puts their warranty and customer service out there plainly in their add, online, on the product, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Christina Wells

customer_reviews.title: Overall good and useful product
customer_reviews.text: It has a good number of outlets, and USB chargers. The only disadvantage is that the outlets are so close that you can’t have two cords side by side. So although it has 8 power outlets , practically on 6 are accessible at a time , which is more than enough. Overall satisfied, highly recommend !!!
customer_reviews.author: Hari  Pokhrel

customer_reviews.title: USB ports broken
customer_reviews.text: Great multi-outlet with USB ports. Comes with holes in the back for wall mounting. I bought 2 a couple years ago and 2 more this year. On one of the older ones, the USB light went out, and the ports stopped working. Wanted to open up the casing to check for a blown fuse, but when I payed off the corner rubber feet I found a 3-pronged screw head (instead of a normal 4-pronged Phillips head). So now it's just a standard multi-outlet with useless USB ports. Well, I like 3 out of 4 units bought.. :-/
customer_reviews.author: S. Westfall

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse in the device charging world
customer_reviews.text: I needed a power bar with a better configuration to accommodate cords with converter plugs for some of my devices and peripherals. This does the job and then some. I wanted to use this as part of my charging station for my devices and this includes 4 USB ports so I don't have to use the converter plugs that came with the devices. I have tested all the ports and I am very happy with the results. This is a power bar that will serve as a workhorse in the charging world.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Lehnen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this power strip. I originally needed a new power strip to charge my devices and this one helps a lot with the built in USB ports. Charges my iPhone, iPad, and other devices great! Just be sure that you have your tablet plugged into the correct amp port, (they are labeled). Plus it has the 2 off set outlets to allow for additional adapters. But the big thing that set this one apart from the others is the angled flat head plug. I really needed this one feature because where I needed to plug is in was behind furniture, and I didn't want the cord to have to stretch across the room.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Little pricey, but a good and useful item.
customer_reviews.text: I needed it to go under my kitchen cabinet and the cord needed to be long enough to go up into the cabinet and along the wall. It does. So, thumbs up. It is what they said it was, it does what it is supposed to do, it shipped in a timely fashion and is overall a good purchase for what I needed. It's hard to elaborate beyond that. I would recommend it if your needs and budget are similar to my own. Not super happy with the price point but what are you gonna do?
customer_reviews.author: LYN SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Handles a desk full of things no problem
customer_reviews.text: I have this power strip full and it doesn't give me any trouble. I wish the USB slots had more juice so I could charge my phone faster without using a brick slot, but oh well, knew it'd probably be slow when i bought it. The cord is a little long for my current use, but it has a velcro cable tie I can use to compact it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymoose

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good size for new "work from home"
customer_reviews.text: Used to only work from home on rare occasions, and now doing it for weeks or ? Needed more outlets and usability in my kitchen and this power strip works great for that. I have other Bestek around the house, and haven't had any issues, so knew it was a brand I liked. This strip has plenty of outlets and the USB outlets as well. More than enough for me, and good for any expanding I may need.
customer_reviews.author: Lostboydp

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not Quick Charge.
customer_reviews.text: Should have read more of the bad reviews and noted that people were reporting the claims of Quick charge were not accurate. Tried multiple cables and all the ports to rule that out as the issue. Cables all work with a known QC charger on my phone and while it charges from the USB ports on the power switch, it definitely is not quick charging. A bit annoying. Hopefully I don’t have the other issues that people seem to be reporting also. I hAd good hopes given the rating and number of reviews, but find myself disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Needed USB Outlets
customer_reviews.text: The power strip is very useful with four USB outlets and the two outlets made for AC adapters without covering up another empty outlet. Got this because we have a charging center and the wall outlet wasn't enough and the power strip was only helping a little. Now we can plug a USB cord in directly and have enough AC outlets to spare. Cord a little long as our wall outlet is next to the power strip and the cord is heavier so it does get in the way. The supplied cord tie helps to keep the cord contained. It does what we need and that's whats important, right?
customer_reviews.author: MrEd

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to order more of these for around the house
customer_reviews.text: This power strip ticks all the boxes. I tested out the USB ports, as many units on the market have some difficulty negotiating the correct amperage with devices such as the iPhone. The amount of current delivered to different devices (iPhone 6 and iPad 3) appears to be identical to that provided by an Apple 2.4A USB charger. No more charger bricks! There was a review saying that the hot and neutral wires were swapped but the unit I received did not have that problem, as tested with a GFCI socket tester. I can't yet speak to the long-term performance of this unit, as I just got it. If it fails I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for efficient space
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was always plugging and unplugging things all the time. This gives you 6 outlets and 4 USBs so you're not taking up space with phone charges in the 6 plugs. 2 of them take larger plugs so they aren't partially blocking their neighboring plug. So far, charging seems to be fast with no issues. I like the little rubber covers too so debris doesn't get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wow, now this is a plug strip!!! I was very happy when I saw this on Amazon, not only has many places to plug things , along with USB outlets, but one of the things that made me order it was that two of the plugs outlets are separated from the other ones so if you have A large plug that you need to put in the plug strip it will fit. I think I will order more these are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: S W

customer_reviews.title: works perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for the bedroom. The built in USB ports work great. I esp like that the ports have rubber covers. Our last surge protector someone tried to plug a normal plug into the USB port and broke it. The layout of this surge protector prevents that. The on/off switch on top prevents it from being accidentally switched off , which also happened on my previous bar. This protector also has a 90 degree plug to plug it in the wall, which is nice in between the wall and bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Great power outlet
customer_reviews.text: Love the spacing of the outlets as most power cords or power packs are a lot bigger the. The outlet footprint and it always makes it so you can’t use the outlet next to it for something else. Also I like how the USB sockets have nice rubber dust covers. And the green light to show you the USB sockets are powered. The power cord feels very thick and heavy duty. The fact that it has 4 USB3 sockets means I do t need use big bulky USP plugs anymore and my other 3 prong power cords now have room to fit.
customer_reviews.author: fasteddiexx1

customer_reviews.title: One of the best power strip configurations I have had and I have ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best power strip configurations I have had and I have many having been a radio /TV repairman, teletype repair/electronic repair/computer repair/telecommunications device repair for many years (since about 1968) I also absolutely love the flat plug even though he could be a little more dangerous but that is only if people are careless and don't know what they are doing. These will be the only kind I get from now on and I am about to buy at least two more. Almost everything is going to a USB charge.
customer_reviews.author: JessTx26

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and more!
customer_reviews.text: This strip is just what I needed. I have a portable, professional audio setup. Several of the devices have "wall-wort" power supplies,,which are a pain with a regular straight power strip. I got three wall-worts, on it with a regular 3-prong plug; plus it has two or three open plugs and all the USB ports. Amazing value for the money. It feels sturdy too.
customer_reviews.author: tekis

customer_reviews.title: Great for organization!
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extension cord for microwave and decided to make the top of the microwave the go to spot for charging as it was by the exit. Tired of chasing chargers, phones, cords, adapters, seeing wires on counter and misplacing around the house. Wall mounted so all cables reach the desired area and I can quickly see what's there when I need to take one on a trip. (Next idea is to Velcro the charging wires with some slack to top/back microwave cord so no wires fall behind microwave. What a relief!
customer_reviews.author: outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Plug It In!
customer_reviews.text: Just moved back from living overseas and quickly needed a power strip to plug in all my newly-bought electronics. I also can't use my adapters for my iPhone and iPad USB cords because they are built for Korean outlets The devices charge perfectly fine when plugged into this power strip. I really like how the outlets are placed at different distances apart to help fit your differently-sized plugs. Plug it in, and turn it on. Easy and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Described
customer_reviews.text: What is there to be said about a power strip? This one comes with all the bells for a reasonable price, $29/ea. Velcro straps and USB port covers are provided to keep things tidy it when not in use or when the cable is too long. I do wish these power strips in general would offer alternative mounting options, such as magnetic or Velcro. Obviously, that would increase its price.
customer_reviews.author: paititi

customer_reviews.title: Slim wall plug.  USB charge fast. Plenty of space for large plugs.
customer_reviews.text: Love this surge protector power strip. It works as intended. The slim wall plug is great as I can plug this behind my dresser and still put the dresser up against the wall without leaving a large gap. USB charging port charge my Samsung Galaxy S7 FAST! Make sure to plug in the 2 Amp outlet though. I'm about to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: AweForLife

customer_reviews.title: Quick Charge USB port only worked for a few weeks, + good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Edit: adjusted rating, as customer service reached out to me 1 year after this review and sent a new power strip, which seems good so far. I bought this mainly for the 3.0 Quick Charge USB port, so I could quickly charge my phone without needing to worry about having the 3.0 wall adapter. It worked great for a few weeks, but then it stopped quick charging and now only functions as a regular USB port. Extremely disappointing product. Customer service is also awful.
customer_reviews.author: Customer510

customer_reviews.title: Not what seller advertised
customer_reviews.text: Product is NOT QC 3.0...does not charge my Note 8 or 9 at QC 3.0 speeds in any port. Just says "Cable charging", not "Fast charging" as it is supposed to. That's a lot of money for a NON QC charger extension cord...stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Good USB voltage but the 110-volt sockets are a little loose.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: I tested the voltage coming out of the USB ports and it's perfect. If it was too low, some items would not receive a full charge. If it was too high, some items could be damaged. The voltage tests at just the right level. Con: Plugs fit somewhat loose in the 110-volt outlet sockets. I fear that should I plug something in that draws a lot of amperage, the socket might overheat at the poor connection. Right now, I have only low-power chargers and a lamp, so there will be no problem for now. I won't be plugging any space heaters in this thing tho....
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Best design out there! Outlets are placed well for multiple adapter type plugs
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful surge protector power strip. The plug that goes in the wall is flat, so it can be placed behind against-the-wall furniture. There are 4 USB 2 outlets which eliminates the need for the wall adapter for many devices. Perhaps the best feature is that the outlets are placed well for large adapter type plug: Rather than being arranged in a row like a train, which fits only standard plugs, they are arranged on the sides of the unit so that larger adapter plugs can hang over the edge without making another outlet unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of plug in locatiom
customer_reviews.text: This item has made things easier for me because it has 8 plug in sections and four USB ports that can handle all of my electrical needs in my cluttered corner. It allows my electrical cords to be organized and not in a jumbled mess or plugged in to extension cords, etc. . I feel safer with the correct way to handle all my plug jns.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Vest

customer_reviews.title: Works great, even for Samsung devices
customer_reviews.text: Great design, though I get variable charge rates for the USB ports based on my testing For a Note 8: Samsung wall charger: estimate 1hr 12 mins to charge This plug, trying all four USB slots 2hrs 25 mins. Regular USB wall charger: 8hrs 3 mins Galaxy s10 Samsung wall charger: estimate 54 mins to charge This strip, trying all four USB ports: 1 hr 34 mins Regular USB wall charger 7hrs 13 mins My conclusion is that this does certainly charger faster than a regular USB charger or even a QC 2.0 charger.
customer_reviews.author: In Philly

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend
customer_reviews.text: There are a lots of other better prices options. The only reason why I have purchest this particular one is the Fast Charging QC that you will find on the product description. The QC is working as standard charger. If you are looking for this feature do not buy it. Other than that it is just a normal unit that you will be able to find way better deals.
customer_reviews.author: Ina Tashi

customer_reviews.title: Description misrepresents product capabilites.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the product description misrepresents the capabilities of this power strip. It does not provide surge protection and it does not provide high speed charging. I am going to return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect..
customer_reviews.text: Perfect... Thick conductors... lots of protected Outlets , heavy duty. Would like to see Mounting Slots for next larger Pan-Head Screw (#10 -32), and able to take a Larger Screw Head for Stronger mounting... you know, like INDUSTRIAL STRENGTH... So it can't blow off in a Light to strong Breeze. If you Pull on a Plug a bit too hard, at an Angle, you could likely tear the Plastic Slots out in doing so. Also would be Wise to Optionally have a (4) Hole Mount pattern, and Stencil that Pattern on the Cardboard Box it's Shipped in for lining up Holes Easier Drilling. Otherwise Great !
customer_reviews.author: Michael Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: They keep getting better!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using BESTEK Power Strip outlets for four or five years now and they just keep getting better. Eight outlets handles most electric needs, the surge protector takes care of expensive electronics and four USB ports is a big plus. Have never had any issues or failures with this brand. Very happy with the quality and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: No UL Halogram Tag
customer_reviews.text: The college my child is attending requires these cords to have the UL Halogram Tag. Although this device does say it meets the UL Std 1363, it will not be excepted at her college. Bummer because I really liked the set up of this one. I need to return it. Wish there was a way to give a not applicable rating. Really can’t rate its use because I never used it.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn NY

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product is a waste of money. I purchased it for my Usa devices so that i can use them in India however as soon as i used it with voltage converter purchased from usa without plugging other devices just this one in voltage converter it gave sparking, very foul smell n then it’s on off switch light started blinking. Now i am afraid to use my appliances with this. Note:- DOACE voltage converter purchased with this is working fine but this Bestek extension is not. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: neha

customer_reviews.title: worked for a while, then I got my iPhone ...
customer_reviews.text: worked for a while, then I got my iPhone 7 and it no longer chargers my phone. And now it's too late to return and replace. That just sucks
customer_reviews.author: GSC

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived promptly, and was well packaged. Seems to be well made, it has a long heavy duty cord with a " flat to the wall " plug, USB charging ports, 2 wall wort sockets, and is circuit breaker protected. It has everything we needed, and is working just fine. CJ, 7/2019 ........... Note: No form of compensation received, or solicited.
customer_reviews.author: C. J.

customer_reviews.title: It is what you see in the picture.
customer_reviews.text: All of the outlets run in the same direction. That's okay except some that some of the cords you may plug in are those goofy l shaped ones that cover the outlet next to it. When I plug my tablet into the usb ports on the strip, it tells me that it is slow charging. I am not sure if it has over charging protection.
customer_reviews.author: White Beard

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my 1930's home with limited outlets
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my 1930's home with limited outlets! Prior to purchasing this I was using the outlet extensions that added USB ports and a couple extra plugins. Both work beautifully. This power strip is great for the office and living room, spaces where I don't want everything plugged into the wall, but along the floor or baseboards. LOVE that the plug-in's face outwards, gives more functionality for multiple plug-in's. I will be purchasing more of these to use as stocking stuffer's for my family this Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Constantly trips GFI
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a couple of months... Then the GFI circuit this was on started tripping. I never thought about a surge protector tripping the circuit, but after trial and error I narrowed the problem down to this power strip
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good surge strip, 4 usb ports is handy too!
customer_reviews.text: Great powert strip with proper load breakage, also, a good size. I'm no electrician, but remember folks, your surge protector can only save your electrontics if it turns off when sonething wonky happens. All honesty, haven't put this one through any tests, but it's ratings seem appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Stonebrew

customer_reviews.title: Nice layout and flexibility, but power cord plugs fit very loosely
customer_reviews.text: This power strip has a very nice layout and the USB ports are especially handy. It's a power strip and hopefully effective surge protector, and does what it's supposed to. Unfortunately, our power cord/power adapter plugs fit very loosely in the outlets. That's fine as long as you use this power strip with devices that are stationary. I use this in a location near my couch, and occasionally use a heating pad that is plugged into it. If I pull the heating pad just a tad too heavily when re-positioning the pad, it comes unplugged, which just adds to the pain. If it weren't for that, I would give this power strip 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Bass

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean look after everything was plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: I have my entire theater system connected and have not had any issues. I can't confirm the buzzing sounds other have claimed but then again it sits behind the equipment. It allowed me to have a nice setup from the power strip I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Ninerfan21

customer_reviews.title: I'd Like to Plug This Product.
customer_reviews.text: I think I have purchased (to date) three of these units, and I will probably order a few more for my office. We're tethered to a world of wires, and for the most part, this configuration of available plugs (electric and USB) should be standard WALL outlets. The first thing I do is plug one of these into a quad outlet, mount it out of the way somewhere, and proceed to connect the countless number of transformers, power supplies and direct connection tp all of my devices. The USB option is a HUGE plus.
customer_reviews.author: KeylimeSteve

customer_reviews.title: the amount of grounded plugs that can be used as ...
customer_reviews.text: the amount of grounded plugs that can be used as well as usb which are available, my daughter and her 3 children and I went on our first vacation in 6 years. everyone had to take cell phones and 2 laptops and a hotspot. the hotei was not equipted to accomadate and was unable to locate a surge protecter that could handle the plugs we needed
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this power strip. It is laid out in such a way you have no problems plugging anything in, the space between 2 of the outlets is wonderful for the larger plugs I need to use. The SUB ports got rid of the large adapter I had to use for my phone plus freed up another outlet to be able to use. Having the longer cord is really helpful too, I live in an older house that had electricity added as an after thought (built in 1935) so there are not many outlets in the living room at all.
customer_reviews.author: T. North

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it seems to be a good product.
customer_reviews.text: The off/on switch does not have a firm snap when operated. When you switch it on the light starts flashing almost as soon as you touch the switch. Otherwise it seems to be a good product. I like the layout of the plugs and the four USB ports. The plugs have the ground to outside so angle cords go to the side, not over other plugs. The wide body makes is stable so I doesn't role over on its side.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Long Cord, Heavy Duty.
customer_reviews.text: Long Cord, Heavy Duty. Plugged in phone and headphone charger, additional charging device for the phone USB, and 4 110V items. Works very well. replaced a very old power strip.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Martin Jr.

customer_reviews.title: So much capacity
customer_reviews.text: So much capacity. I bought this to replace older ones and also needed to make a tech charging center. I placed one on my dining table where kids do homework and can also charge their phones which they used charge on their laptops. Now all the cords stay off the floor and the dogs cannot reach them. The area stays tidy and we are no longer searching for charge blocks since you can plug directly in. I like the surge protector as an added feature.
customer_reviews.author: Luz Negron-Bennett

customer_reviews.title: The consistency of this product.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes when purchasing surge protector you're purchasing on the hopes that all the sockets work accordingly, and in this case this product work amazingly. I am able to plug adapters (cube shaped) into this surge protector without having any difficulties with trying to make space for other cables. All the HDMI charging ports work wonderful. I have a double monitor setup, Alienware Aurora (gaming PC), PS 4 and a 2018 Mac mini receiving power from this outlet. I am not experiencing any delays, shortage of power or any form of obstruction. Overall, this is an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: AkeemH

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, expect a fire
customer_reviews.text: It's not a Surge Protector at all, it's a power strip. The USB plugs flicker power and was sending so much power it was bugging out my PS Classic System. Seller contacted me about a refund after posting the initial review, so there's that at least. Be wary of other user's reviews too, too many of these have problems to ignore. Listing should be properly updated with POWER STRIP, and not SURGE PROTECTOR
customer_reviews.author: J. Busby

customer_reviews.title: I own a 6 outlet Bestek strip...
customer_reviews.text: I use it beside the bed for the USB ports so I don't need to have multiple USB chargers plugged in. Well it is such a great product that I ran out of sockets on the 6 outlet strip due to the number of things I have plugged into it. Since the 6 outlet worked out so well, I bought this 8 outlet one and moved the 6 outlet one to the other side of the bed. The two outlets at the end are great for larger wall wort type adapters so they don't end up blocking the other outlets.
customer_reviews.author: T. Masoner

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use for intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this in my office to minimize the number of cords from wall to desk. Unfortunately, the plugs have a lower electric flow than I need and wouldn't charge my laptop, even when it was the only thing plugged in. I'm keeping it to use elsewhere, but be aware of that if you want to use it on high load items.
customer_reviews.author: Petra R

customer_reviews.title: Weird USB standards
customer_reviews.text: This power strip is alright, but note that the USB ports are nebulously defined for a reason. "4 ports (5.2a max)" is what the product description says, but if you zoom in you'll notice that the ports are labeled with different amperages. There's two high power ports, one low power port, and one "auto" port. From my experience that allows you to charge one modern phone and two low-power devices, leaving the low power port empty. In my case this comfortably charges an HTC One M9, an old model Chromecast, and my bedside clock which for some reason is USB.
customer_reviews.author: D. McAloon

customer_reviews.title: Nice! Just what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: We have way too many electronic devices in our bedroom. Wires going everywhere. I've got one of these on my side of the bed and one on hers. Now we can have all our devices charging, with plenty of outlets for lamps, clocks, tablets, and laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Gali

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a solid unit at a reasonable price but had to return as outlets would not hold plugs tight and make a good connections. Possibly just one bad unit as I have purchased other BESTEK items in the past with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Had for a little more than a year, when it stopped working. There is no reset, probably a blown fuse inside, but since they use security screws, the average person cannot get at it to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Luddite

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. I have a 6 outlet G.E. surge protector that didn't save my big screen TV ( 1 year old) during a power surge. I have a lot of electronic devices and don't want to lose another device so I purchased this item. So far another power surge and a lightning strike that knocked out power has occurred since installing this surge protector. Nothing has been damaged thanks to this item. Seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: paul m.

customer_reviews.title: Sat., Dec. 08, 2018 Very nice Power Strip and it comes with FOUR!  USB Slots.
customer_reviews.text: Sat., Dec. 08, 2018 Very nice Power Strip and it comes with FOUR! USB Slots. We are enjoying the addition of 4 more plugs and very happy that we chose the 12’ cord. Just wonderful so far. Substantial cord that reaches behind a computer desk (olden days lol) and effortlessly conforms to bends. Nice product and glad this one was our choice.
customer_reviews.author: Che

customer_reviews.title: Good product & value for money
customer_reviews.text: Charging power is good and I love that it comes with the other types of charging ports. The cord length is so short it’s annoying to me however my teenage son that has everything from a computer, cell phone, echo dot, iPad, Xbox One doesn’t seem to mind.
customer_reviews.author: missomnipotent

customer_reviews.title: excellent power strip with long cord and vertical flat plug
customer_reviews.text: as others have noted, this model with the 12' cord doesn't have as much surge protection as some, but it probably has enough. i'm using in my living room to provide power on the far side of a long couch in an area where in the 1960's they were sure power would never be needed. ;) good quality cable and box.
customer_reviews.author: bob mills

customer_reviews.title: Surprising compact and well designed.
customer_reviews.text: Using this inside a BlueLounge cable box and it leaves LOTS of room for extra wire, charging bricks, even its own extra wire. It came securely packaged with protection on block and wire, and has its own velcro tie attached. The USB ports are charging correctly on iEverything. I am very pleased and feel it was an excellent value, well designed and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: dontlietome

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: I have this bar permanently connected to my bedroom wall (well, "permanently"). I have my desktop tower (and all accessories: monitor, printer, etc) plugged into it, as well as my MacbookPro laptop, my Bose speaker charging dock, and I use the USB ports for FitBit, iPhone, etc. It's great! I love the extra USB ports! And the fact that there's more room for the two end outlets, allowing for those bigger cords that take up so much space.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth P.

customer_reviews.title: awesome product
customer_reviews.text: 90degrees wall plug saves spaces and is very convinient. I love it. It has many outlet+ usb ports. Forget about usb chargers... you need cables only from now. Customer service is really good. There was a surge and the power supply broke. I got a new one in mail few days after I complained.
customer_reviews.author: Valentyn The Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for powering or charging my many devices.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new power strip because I have obtained many devices and all need power and this is good because I can power all my devices and have room to charge my other devices while I sleep and if need more room there are the 4 USB Ports that I can use, so this suits my needs perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: George S

customer_reviews.title: USB chargers useless if TV plugged into same power strip
customer_reviews.text: Found that with TV plugged into power strip, when trying to use USB charging ports, use of the USB interfered with OTA TV transmission. Regular power block for cell phone plugged into power strip did not cause same interference, telling me that it’s an inherent design issue with the USB charging circuitry.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great surge protector
customer_reviews.text: I ordered because of the long cord length. It seems that all my electric plugs are behind furniture and this length cord and the flat plug head are essential. The lay out of the plugins is also well thought out. Add in the USB ports and it’s a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: 3A USB is just enough to charge my Chromebook while in use, just barely. Even with Chromebook off, 3A charges pretty slowly compared to OEM charger. Only one 3A port is available. Otherwise this power strip lies flat and appears very well made.
customer_reviews.author: ACAR

customer_reviews.title: Charges phone fast!
customer_reviews.text: I love the quick charge feature. My phone might not say it's quick charging, but the speed of charging is definitely noticeable. I use this for trade shows, so I can plug in equipment and not take up valuable outlets just to charge my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Very VERY long cord!
customer_reviews.text: The long cord was great because the house built in the 50s has only two outlets per bedroom! I like being able to plug my phone directly into it, and it sure did have enough outlets for my needs! I will definitely buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: lscs102

customer_reviews.title: works great love the added USB ports
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work great. Love the added USB ports. I use this as a power block hung under my standing desk. It works exceptionally well and I really like having the two plugs separated by a space at the end allowing for plugging in larger plugs with transformers.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Works well, mountable, charges well!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I purchased this and I’m very very pleased. I can charge several items at once and I have my PC and monitor plugged into it as well. Also, I mounted it underneath my desk so it’s very convenient. This 2nd unit is mounted in my daughter’s room.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperMom

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 60+ days.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 7/31/16. Stopped working 10/25/16. The USB ports still work but the electrical ports don't. The Red light illuminates while plugged in but no power to the electrical. I'm past the thirty day return period so I guess i'll try my luck with warranty service.
customer_reviews.author: MartaVme

customer_reviews.title: Plugs get loose over time
customer_reviews.text: The size, color, outlet spacing, and usb plug options were very nice. I was initially very pleased with the power strip and I bought two; one for my side of the bed and one for my wife . However, after a few months, the plugs started getting loose and things world get unplugged with any jostling at all. This happened for both strips. Slight wiggling the cords that are plugged in causes them to lose power, so for instance, we might find our phone batteries dead in the morning even though they were plugged in all night. Disappointed. I’m back on amazon now to find something else that hopefully is more reliable over time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Best surge protector I ever got
customer_reviews.text: This was designed for modern electronics. Aside from the traditional outlets, there are some specifically set up to accommodate the oversize plugs (the ones that normally would cover up two or three outlet spaces), and there are special USB charging outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Morgan

customer_reviews.title: USB outlets are a great feature. Outlets are brilliantly child-resistant
customer_reviews.text: Comes packaged in a neat box. Has a wrap on the cord you can use to lash the cord together. Heavy, wide design keeps this firm on the floor. USB outlets are a great feature. Outlets are brilliantly child-resistant. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grant

product_meta.title: BESTEK 8-Outlet 6 Feet Extension Cord Power Strip with USB 15A 1875W Surge Protector with 5V 4.2A 4 USB Charging Port Desktop Charging Station,600Joule,Ultra-Compact Wide Spaced Outlet for Large Plug
feature_bullets: 8 AC Outlets + 4 Smart USB Charging Ports: The power strip supplying 8 AC outlets(1875W/15A) and 4 USB charging ports (Total 5V/4.2A/21W),supports a wide range of voltage (100~250V) enough for PC, tablet, smartphone,laptop, camera, phones, iPads, batteries,Fax,stereos, e-reader, bluetooth headphones,Speakers etc.The BESTEK desktop charging station with 4 Smart IQ Identification usb ports auto-detects and self-adjusts current to charging different USB-powered devices simultaneously.

Advanced Multi-protection Safety Features: The Lighted on/off switch with integrated circuit breaker for overload protection of all outlets,so your devices,electronics & appliances will be protected from voltage fluctuations, surges and Lightning strikes etc.he power strip adopted newly PC+ABS Alloy Plastic shell with1382℉ flame-retardant material and High conductivity integrated phosor Copper Cords.High-end solid capacitor and Mutiple built-in Premium Circuitry fully protection.

Wide Spacing AC outlets Seperately: Two widely spaced AC outlets accommodate large oddly shaped power adapters,charger and plugs,the multi directional layout of the outlets,additional outlets facing sideways,so they aren't partially blocking their neighboring plug,The separately spaced outlet on each side is perfect for plugging in items that take up more room.The three pronged plugs are spaced nicely.

Other Noticeble Advantages: FCC and ETL listed,UL certified 3-prong grounded plug power cord.,14AWG thicker 6 ft 3 prong power cords to avoid over-heating when using high-power electrical appliances,wear/shock resistant.The Velcro straps was provided to keep things tidy it when the cable is too long.The keyhole slots on the back of the power strip allow you to mount it on the wall or baseboard flexibly.

Reliable Quality Warranty what You Get: Any questions or disatisfactions with your purchase,24H x 7D technical and friendly customer service support, BESTEK guarantee you refund within 180 Days, and 18-Month Product Replacement Warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars3,704 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
